children.name: Fauna
children.description: Animal life of any particular region or time

children.name: Vertebrates
children.description: Oraganisms that have vertebral column

children.name: Reptiles
children.description: Vertebrates that have four limbs

children.name: Amphibians
children.description: Vertebrates that can live on both land and water

children.name: Birds
children.description: Vertebrates characterised by wings,beaked-jaws

children.name: Mammals
children.description: Vertebrates that give birth to live young

children.name: Fish
children.description: Vertebrates that breathe through gills

children.name: Invertebrates
children.description: Oraganisms that don't have vertebral column

children.name: Protozoa
children.description: The single-celled invertebrates

children.name: Flatworms
children.description: Soft-bodied Invertebrates that donot have specialized circulatory and respiratory organs

children.name: Coelenterates
children.description: Aquatic Invertebrates with radially symmetrical bodyform

children.name: Annelid worms
children.description: Ringed worms and segmented worms

children.name: Molluscs
children.description: Marine invertebrates with significant cavity for breathing and excretion

children.name: Echinoderms
children.description: Marine Invertebrates with radial symmetrical structure

children.name: Arthropods
children.description: Invertebrates that have exoskeleton

children.name: Flora
children.description: Plant life occuring in particular region or time

children.name: Cryptogamae
children.description: Plants that reproduce by spores

children.name: Thallophyta
children.description: Plants with undifferentiated body

children.name: Algae
children.description: plants that reproduce by cell division

children.name: Fungi
children.description: Unicellular organism

children.name: Lichens
children.description: Its a composite organism living among filaments among fungus

children.name: Bryophyta
children.description: Non-vascular plants

children.name: Pteridophyta
children.description: Vascular plants that reproduce via spores

children.name: Phanerogamae
children.description: Plants that produce seeds

children.name: Gymnospermae
children.description: Plants with cones as reproductive organs

children.name: Angiospermae
children.description: Plants with flowers as reproductive organs

children.name: Monocot
children.description: Flowering plants whose seed contain one embryonic leaf

children.name: Dicot
children.description: Flowering plants whose seeds contain two embryonic leaves
